p: The leaf phenotype showed that the leaves of W. chinensis, W. trilobata, and their hybrid exhibited wilting with the prolongation of the leaf in vitro time, among which the W. chinensis displayed the most obvious performance ( Figure 1A,B), and the leaf edge angle had curled at 3 h ( Figure 1A). Figure 1C shows the changes of leaf water loss for the three plants. With the extension of the in vitro time, the water loss rate of leaves of W. chinensis was the highest, and that of W. trilobata was the lowest. The water loss rate of hybrid leaves was between those of its parents.
